articles.title: Jimmy Cliff, who helped introduce reggae to the world, dies at 81 - The Washington Post
articles.description: The Jamaican reggae star had a breakout performance in the 1972 film “The Harder They Come,” playing a singer turned outlaw.
articles.content: Jimmy Cliff, the Jamaican reggae star whose lead role in the 1972 cult-movie sensation The Harder They Come helped introduce the pulsating island dance beat to a global audience, has died. He was 81.
